Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: @coinmonks || CoinCodeCap Regarding burning coins: 1) Komodo is not a company, no obligation for user gains,  in fact thatâ€™s more of a liability because that is an expectation of profit from the issuer and others which is one of the ways we have avoided being classified as a security .  There is a mechanism in play that accomplishes the same goals, lack of reward claiming , with only about 50% claiming their rewards about 12k coins per day never come into existence. Re: 3rd party chains as a focus.    Having experience with soliciting coins for the service,  most arenâ€™t financially or technically in the position to receive it .  Especially if it requires a code audit.  Then there is the chains it would require extensive work to DPoW such as ethereum forks.  Which due to limited number of them itâ€™s not worth devoting efforts to this time.  Most DPoW demand will come from Kmd created chains as it doesnâ€™t require a code audit which costs tens of thousands and takes away from manpower.   Iâ€™m not worried about amount of chains joining the ecosystem.  Itâ€™s not hard to specialize a purpose into a chain.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
We havenâ€™t started 3rd party notarizing tools, documents, transactions.  Think about 1000 companies notarizing their own docs in dealings with others.  Even if they have a notary network of their own of 6 nodes requiring 2 signatures.  That is 6000 nodes requiring kmd to notarize to kmd.

7000 kmd will get 20 years of notarizations.
7000 x 1000 x 6 = 13 million.

That is 10% of current supply, 6.5% of total supply only for notarizing 3rd party documents.

This is ONE application of antara modules that enables logic and data to work in the transactional system.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: Bonafide usage of the komodo currency for bitcoin level security on applications.
